humanum_full_description_en:
Jia Jinwen from the " door " from the " kou ", or from the second " kou ". Xiaozhuan starts with the sound of " mouth " and " door ", the original meaning is interrogation, "Shuwen": "Inquiry, interrogation. From the mouth, the sound of the door." Jiajin inscription and Xiaozhuan are the same, but the words they represent may not be the same . The meaning of the incomplete oracle bone inscriptions is unknown. Bronze " Q " word used for the name, the history of the bell and asked: "History from Chad to ask (for) Lei Chung." The " question " in the Jiajin inscription does not have the meaning of interrogation, so the original meaning of the word it represents is not necessarily interrogation.

" Question " in Qin bamboo slips is used for interrogation and has the same meaning as the word represented by Xiaozhuan. "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. Legal Questions and Answers" Jan. 10: "A thief can't make a money, go to the room B, and B fjue, ask B's argument, can (how) be corrupted (also)? No matter." The whole sentence steals less than a dollar and goes to B Home, B did not notice, and asked how B should be punished? It should not be a crime.

" Question " in Mawangdui silk script is also used as the original meaning, referring to questioning. "Mawangdui Silk Book. The 12th line of the Book of Political Strategists of the Warring States Period: "Jun Fengyang was very angry with Qi, so that Shao (Zhao) asked his ministers." He pointed out that King Fengyang was very angry with Qiguo and ordered Zhao Guo to ask me about this.

Also, the inscriptions " asked " to try to borrow " smell ," said its word meaning, and " smell " and " marriage ", "䎽" Old with character, visible " ask " and " faint " the sounds pass the word. The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period used " faint " as " question ", "Guodian Chujian. Lu Mu asked Zisi" Jane 3: "To the (toward) person I faint (asks) the loyal minister Yu Zisi."

The handed down documents often use " question " as " wen ", which means telling, "Warring States. "Qi Cesan": "Or to ask Meng Changjun", Gaoyou note: "Ask, report." Or it means news, information, "Zuo Zhuan. The Eighth Years of Zhuang Gong: "When the period is over, the public will not come." Or it means fame, "Mozi. Fei Mingxia": "Then the Guangyu Ling asked the world."

humanum_full_description:
甲金文從「門」從「口」，或從二「口」。小篆從「口」，「門」聲，本義是訊問，《說文》：「問，訊也。从口，門聲。」甲金文與小篆形同，唯兩者所代表的詞未必相同。甲骨文辭殘，其義不明。金文「問」字用為人名，史問鐘：「史問自乍(作)昪鐘」。甲金文「問」均未有用作訊問的意思，因此它所代表的詞本義不一定是訊問。

　　秦簡中「問」用作訊問，與小篆所代表的詞詞義相同。《睡虎地秦簡．法律答問》簡10：「甲盜不盈一錢，行乙室，乙弗覺，問乙論可(何)殹(也)？毋論。」全句指甲偷去不足一錢，前往乙家，乙沒有發覺，問乙應當如何論處？不應論罪。

　　馬王堆帛書「問」亦用作本義，指詢問。《馬王堆帛書．戰國縱橫家書》第12行：「奉陽君甚怒於齊，使勺(趙)足問之臣」，指奉陽君對齊國感到甚為憤怒，命令趙國向我詢問這件事。

　　另，金文「問」嘗借「聞」字表示其詞義，而「聞」與「婚」、「䎽」古同字，可見「問」與「昏」音近字通。戰國竹簡即曾借「昏」為「問」，《郭店楚簡．魯穆公問子思》簡3：「向(嚮)者吾昏(問)忠臣於子思。」

　　傳世文獻多借「問」為「聞」，表示告訴，《戰國策．齊策三》：「或以問孟嘗君」，高誘注：「問，告。」或表示音訊、信息，《左傳．莊公八年》：「期戍，公問不至。」或表示名聲，《墨子．非命下》：「遂得光譽令問於天下。」
humanum_short_description: 甲金文從「門」從「口」，或從二「口」。小篆從「口」，「門」聲，本義是訊問、審問。引申為詢問、疑問。

Radicals: 門, 口  (gate, mouth)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you run into a gate mouth first, you’re going to have a problem. Smashing your mouth into a gate is going to hurt. A lot. The problem you’re now in is one of getting to a hospital and having your mouth sewn back on.
Imagine having your mouth bashed into a gate. It’s going to hurt. Imagine how painful this would be and how problematic it is.
Reading Mnemonic
The reason you ran mouth first into this gate was because you were being chased by a monster (もん). A monster in and of itself is a big enough problem as is, let alone smashing your mouth into a gate. You poor, hapless soul.
Monsters are scary. Maybe you’ve had a dream where you were being chased by one. Remember how scary that is when you see this kanji.
